column5: Thanks for all the help guys. A Walleye Central reader got us hooked up with a camp in Perrault Falls that had a cabin available and were more than happy to accommodate us for a night. This is a very helpful site!!
ear falls has 2 motels also trillium motel and hotel 105 bar and grill
They are doing work on the dam at Ear Falls. The motels are pretty much booked for the entire summer with construction workers.
Trillium Motel in Ear Falls
Thanks, but read the post just before yours.

We come from the other direction, so Dryden would be out of the way. Not sure if any camps in the Perrault Falls area would have a cabin available to let a group crash for a night? Any ideas would be appreciated. Thanks guys.
Give V-Bay Gord a call and see if he has anything available for a night. Vermilionbaylodge.com PjShorthorn
There is also Gold Arrow camp you can try. They are just south of Perrault Falls. Good people there too. They might have roomSent from my iPhone using Tapatalk Pro
Maybe if you said what routes you are taking and how far away from Ear Falls you are willing to stay, someone might have more choices.
We are coming up through Sioux Narrows. We can look at staying there, but were hoping to get a little closer.
The Sioux Narrows Motel was recently remodeled. I stayed there last year. You can walk to the Dock house or Big John's for food.
You could detour 7 miles west and go to Kenora where there are lots of motels
vermilion bay has two motels.northside motelpine grove motel
Thanks, but both are full. The trip was just put together a few days ago or I would have had something booked long ago. Now just trying to find something last minute.
just thought of a couple options. lost bay resorton cliff lake has another camp thats usually not busy.i had guys stay there and its fine.888-884-8870807-529-6511 this is camp numbergood luck

Are there any places to spend an overnight between Vermillion Bay and Ear Falls? We are trying to find a place to stay on a Friday night as we can't get into our camp until Saturday. Vermillion Bay is booked.
i believe there is Timberlane lodge in ear falls. 866-539-8117. Other than that might have to drive into red lake...about an hour north and they have hotels.
The Friday night before getting to the Saturday to Saturday lodge was always a sleep in the truck night. I might be too old for that now.
We have done that before, just checking for something a little more comfortable!
yeah...not sleeping in my truck on vacation. Now a blow up bed in the back with a topper...all for it. i will take a hotel and hot shower on vacation though.
Did you contact the Northside Motel in Vermillion Bay? 807-227-5339
What about just staying in Dryden for the night and making the drive from Dryden to Ear Falls in the morning?
We travel on Hoghway 71 on our trip up to Ear Falls. I remember seeing several motels along that highway - try once of these spots as a place to spend the night.
Most hotels are booked on Friday nights up until the mayfly hatch. There is a place to camp about 10 miles north of ear falls called Pakwash Provincial Park. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk Pro
If you are coming up through Dryden their is the Town & Country Motel in Dryden . Nothing fancy but clean & convenient location. 807-223-2377Later, Jay
